experience.title: Senior Software Engineer at Payoneer
contentParagraphs: As part of the Money-Movement-In team, main challenges were to integrate with new external banks allowing accounts creations and in-payments processing.
Async services communication is key to ensure the best performance, reliability, and scalability of the system.
Update our codebase from legacy to a more standardized architecture. E.g., make services compatible with Docker, stateless, and integration with k8s.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer (Backed .NET) at DocPlanner
contentParagraphs: Design, develop, test and monitor new features to help doctors to manage his patients and bookings.
Enhance the current code base by improving the performance, creating new tests or doing meaningful refactoring to the code.
Keep the lights on by investigating and finding the root cause for problems in our platform and ensure a fast issue resolution.
Had the opportunity of participate in the designing, coding, deployment, monitoring and support of new cross-company services used by other teams.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer for Openbank
contentParagraphs: I served as a Senior Software Developer at Openbank, a client of Mimacom. My role primarily focused on frontend development using React.js. The primary challenge was to develop a new on-boarding application while adhering to best practice standards and incorporating Openbank technologies.A portion of the application required integration into the mobile app, which presented an additional challenge. I also conducted numerous job interviews for candidates interested in joining Mimacom.

experience.title: Full Stack Engineer
contentParagraphs: I served as a full-stack engineer to successfully complete and launch the ConsolFreight web application. The primary objective of this system was to facilitate the sale of cargo routes to individuals and businesses looking to ship their goods. One of the major challenges involved translating complex industry requirements into a coherent domain definition that could be implemented in the application. I utilized a combination of technologies, including Aspnet MVC, MVC Core, ReactJs/Redux, and also played a key role in setting up CI/CD pipelines using Azure.

experience.title: Lead Frontend Software Engineer
contentParagraphs: Developed the web frontend system to display agriculture field data to users. The system displays maps showing the position and status of equipment. It also provides real-time weather condition information. The system sends alerts to users when specific parameters deviate from the expected range. Users can filter and manipulate the data. One of the key challenges was integrating various technologies, such as AngularJS and Google Maps. Additionally, we successfully migrated from Google Maps to Mapbox and from AngularJS to ReactJS over time.

experience.title: Fullstack Software Engineer
contentParagraphs: I collaborated with the Xmovo team to develop a new social network website focused on training and fitness. This ambitious project featured a range of components, including a feeds section, notification system, chat functionality, e-commerce for training programs and memberships, live video training classes, and more. Unfortunately, the project was not successful, and the owners decided to close it.
Key Technologies: C#, ASP.NET MVC 5, Entity Framework 6, AngularJS, React.js, SignalR, Domain-Driven Design (DDD), SOLID principles, and more.

experience.title: Lead Software Developer
contentParagraphs: Develop and maintain all kind of software in the company. Mainly on .NET technologies.

experience.title: Freelancer and Previous jobs
contentParagraphs: During my university years, I primarily worked as a freelance developer for various companies.
I developed numerous WPF applications and gained proficiency in best practices and design patterns, with MVVM being a prominent example, particularly in the context of WPF and Silverlight.
I collaborated with colleagues to establish the doiTTeam, an initiative focused on organizing our freelance work.
I successfully completed a couple of projects during my internship with a specific company I was assigned to.

During this period, I acquired valuable skills in real-world application development, primarily focusing on .NET technologies, including C#, WPF, Windows Forms, NHibernate, ActiveRecord, Entity Framework, various ORMs, and database systems like SQL Server and SQLite.

education.title: Computer Science Bachelor of Science (BSc)
contentParagraphs: I graduated with a strong foundation in Computer Science, where I gained knowledge in a wide range of subjects.
My coursework covered fundamental topics such as mathematics, logic, and algebra, providing a solid grounding for my studies.
In addition, I delved into various Computer Science-related subjects, including programming, compilers, artificial intelligence, databases, networking, optimizations, and more.

projects.title: Rulyotano.CrossCutting
contentParagraphs: A set of dotnet helper libraries. Currently, the most interesting is a helper to interpolate points by using Bezier curves.

projects.title: rulyotano.crosscutting.js
contentParagraphs: A set of javascript helper libraries. The idea is to do the same as in the Rulyotano.CrossCutting ones.

projects.title: Tree Extended
contentParagraphs: A npm library that we can use to get directory tries in a custom way. Also implemented a VsCode extension to do it easily.

projects.title: My MinesSweeper! ðŸ˜Ž
contentParagraphs: Just a fun project, but it is a good example of how to use ReactJs + Redux pattern. Also, I play it a lot when I'm bored.

projects.title: Mimacom Challenge ðŸ’ª
contentParagraphs: This project is challenge to enter into Mimacom company as a frontend developer. It can help as a React + Redux example.

projects.title: Mui Profile (this site!)
contentParagraphs: Done using React + NextJs + Material UI, this is the source code of this site. It is automatically released to github pages on push to master.

projects.title: Othello/Reversi game with AI players
contentParagraphs: This was a project for the AI course in the University: creating AI players to play Othello game. We did a tournament with all the students player. This is the winner!

projects.title: WPF draggable animated panel
contentParagraphs: Back then, Safari web browser had a similar panel and I wanted to have it in WPF.

projects.title: Sample of Working Message Queue
contentParagraphs: Sample project to create a message queue to process long running tasks.

projects.title: Sample of Creating Servers in Sequence with ZooKeeper
contentParagraphs: The goal of this sample project is to be able to have many servers with a unique sequence number.

projects.title: CV
contentParagraphs: This open-source project offers a LaTeX-based CV template that is designed for professional use.

articles.title: Building a Distributed Sequence Generator with ZooKeeper and C#
contentParagraphs: This demo project explores how to assign unique, dynamic sequence numbers to multiple server instances in a distributed environment, inspired by challenges that surface when designing things like global ID generators.

articles.title: Latency improved by 20x times! How to do it?
contentParagraphs: Explains how I manged to improve the latency of a service by 20x times. The article explains the steps I took to achieve this, including the tools and techniques used.

articles.title: Interpolate 2D points, using Bezier curves in WPF
contentParagraphs: Do you know how to do, from a list of points to get a curve line that pass through all of them? In this article we explain how to do it by using Bezier Curves.

articles.title: Tree-Extended, a tool to get custom directories trees
contentParagraphs: Here we explain how to use a tool developed to match the needs to document projects directories in a very customized way. I created a command line tool and also, a VsCode extension in order to do that.

articles.title: Get Your Personal Website for Free: Create it with ReactJs
contentParagraphs: I want to show how create for free a personal webpage by using GitHub Pages + ReactJs + NextJs + Material UI.

recommendedBooks.title: Clean Code
recommendedBooks.author: Robert C. Martin
contentParagraphs: This gives us a lot of good tips to write better code. We need to code thinking others will read it.
I liked this book a lot. I tend to use these advices in the day by day coding, not all of them, you can pick the ones you find useful.

recommendedBooks.title: Clean Architecture
recommendedBooks.author: Robert C. Martin
contentParagraphs: This book is like an extension of Clean Code. It is like same principles applied to software architecture.

recommendedBooks.title: .NET Microservices: Arch. for Containerized .NET Applications
recommendedBooks.author: Cesar de la Torre, Bill Wagner, Mike Rousos
contentParagraphs: Good book to get introduced into the microservices world. We can learn by actually coding a microservice.

recommendedBooks.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
recommendedBooks.author: Gayle Laakmann McDowell
contentParagraphs: Not only to prepare for coding interviews. This one teach you a lot of things that every software engineer needs to know.

recommendedBooks.title: Domain-Driven Design Distilled
recommendedBooks.author: Vaughn Vernon
contentParagraphs: 'The book' to learn DDD.

recommendedBooks.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
recommendedBooks.author: Martin Kleppmann
contentParagraphs: A long book, but this is like a mandatory reference for some software architecture sections.
You can find how different types of DBs are implemented or how distributed system manage replication.

recommendedBooks.title: System Design Interview - An insider's guide
recommendedBooks.author: Alex Xu
contentParagraphs: Very good to prepare your self to coding interviews's system design questions. But also have I have learned a lot of things regarding to software architecture and how big systems works.
Also, the references you can find here are gold.

recommendedBooks.title: System Design Interview - An insider's guide: Volume 2
recommendedBooks.author: Alex Xu, Sahn Lam
contentParagraphs: An extension of volume 1 with some more examples. As the first volume, this is very good. This one continues teaching us a lot of amazing stuffs.
Again, follow the references.

recommendedBooks.title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
recommendedBooks.author: Martin Fowler
contentParagraphs: Very good book. I've realized that I didn't know what 'refactoring' means. I was doing something different without know it wasn't 'refactoring'.
